publicationstmt.publisher: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-09-03 12:38:10 -0400.

repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.abstract: The collection consists of a daybook, 1881-1882, kept by the proprietor of a general store in Derby, Connecticut.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: F.D. Jackson was a the proprietor of a general store in Derby, Connecticut, 1881-1882.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This daybook, 1881-1882, was kept by the proprietor of a general store in Derby, Connecticut and bears the stationer's label "A. E. Gould, Traveling Stationery Dealer, New Haven, Connecticut."

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed and is likely disorganized. Individual items may be difficult to find.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection was purchased from dealer Whitlock Farms in 1970.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted because it is unprocessed. While it is likely that portions of the collection may be viewed, access must be managed by an archivist.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming with the laws of copyright. Whenever possible, the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives will provide information about copyright owners and other restrictions, but the legal determination ultimately rests with the researcher. Requests for permission to publish material from this collection should be discussed with the Head of Special Collections and Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, F.D. Jackson Papers, 1881-1882. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Jackson Papers).
